metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9998 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SPIP 3.1.x suffer from a Reflected Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability in /ecrire/exec/info_plugin.php involving the `$plugin` parameter, as demonstrated by a /ecrire/?exec=info_plugin URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9998` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

spip - 3.1.4-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spip package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.4-2').
